dashboard.label: Configuration Health
dashboard.description: Identifies common issues relating to stanza and conf syntax

event.title: This type of stanza can be declared without a standard [stanza] header at the beginning of a .conf file. While syntatecally legal, these stanzas can often be caused by mistypes.

search.query: (`conf_files_index` sourcetype="splunk_conf_file" NOT (conf_app=system conf_context=default)) `include_deletions("*", "*", "*", "*")` | `latest` | search NOT conf_stanza=* OR conf_stanza="null"

event.title: Stanzas which contain entries without an equals sign. This is syntatecally incorrect and often indicative of larger issues

search.query: (`conf_files_index` sourcetype="splunk_conf_file" NOT (conf_file=macros.conf AND conf_app=*conf*TA) NOT (conf_app=system conf_context=default)) `include_deletions("*", "*", "*", "*")` | `latest` | `normalize_multiline_values` | `confdata2mv` | eval suspicious=mvfilter(match(conf_data, "^[^\=]+$")) | eval suspicious=mvfilter(!match(suspicious, "^\s*$")) | eval suspicious=mvfilter(!match(suspicious, "^\s*\|.*$")) | eval suspicious=mvfilter(!match(suspicious, "^\s*\#.*$")) | eval suspiciousc=mvcount(suspicious) | search suspiciousc>0
